intro: Pavetta leucosphaera, commonly known as the white-fruited pavetta, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruits are fleshy berries that mature to a pale yellow or white color, giving it its common name. The plant is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
